author: {'steamid': '76561198083880494', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1580840376}
review:
Small glitch starting the game, it doesnt seem to start...click game icon again though and you get it going. Minor bug I am sure they will fix, they know about it.

The forest is fantastic, the foliage moves as you brush through it, the fire and water are astonishingly real looking. The lighting is wonderful, you feel like you are in a real forest you can almost smell the rotting wood and fallen leaves. It doesn't crunch under your feet, it scuffs and squealches as you trod along muddy tracks. Small pebbles scatter, wooden bridges creak and and crack. Yes there are some minor glitches but the realism is quite incredible, it is perfectly drawn.

Now for the scares, birds flap out of bins and woodpiles, things fall off shelves, broomsticks fall over with a clatter. Bird callsand deer come from hidden parts of the wood roaring and scattering mud as they run across your path. Leaves fall and softly settle on the ground, they hit a bush then slide off to land on the floor or in the water, Autumn/Fall is upon us it seems and the daylight seems watery with the dim prospects of Winter just weeks away.

I won't mention the scarecrow...damn I just did...

Save points are found as altars, not only are they save points but I seem to be collecting them as well, at least I have a count of how many I've found so far. Similarly I've found two sets of human bones and seem to be collecting those as well, though I have no idea why. There are notes left along the way to read, they recount the lives of people that once lived nearby, nobody around now though except the follower, the dark shadow you see on the trailer scampering around. He has crossed my path twice now and seems harmless enough...I'll let you know if/when he kills me and eats me though.

Yes this is part one of four, yes it is early access and yes, so far not a lot has happened but I've only been at it an hour but come see for yourself, this is so beautifully done, they could have photographed every inch of a real living forest and copied it, it really is that good.

A few hours later.

Did i call the shadowy follower he...I think I need to change that to a she now that I understand more. I just finished the game and if anything, it got better so all the writing above was only about part one...and it get's better.

The ending made me cry, starting the final level the music was perfect as you were coming into morning again after a very difficult night, fear was being pushed back as daylight returned and the music reflected that. Houses began to appear and this strange shadow that had been following you, appearing at odd times and scaring you, you start to understand who it was and maybe what horrible thing happened to her and that makes you begin to feel pity for her and her presence becomes less frightening, her scares merely pranks played upon you by a youth and the sinister becomes fondness. And when you realise the final act and what it means for her, well I was in tears by that point so I won't mention it here, it was such a fulfilling satisfying conclusion to a terribly sad story.

The game has a few jumpscares and creepy moments but it's not too bad. There is no dialogue but plenty of collectable notes to read but for me, ultimately, it was the forest that was the best. The realism of the forest, the weather, the fire, the water, the ambient sounds, all of it was just amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015873290', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1444258300}
review:
В играх очень ценю атмосферу в первую очередь и на чём себя ловлю - предпочитаю больше мрачную.
У этой игры с ней всё просто прекрасно, постоянное ощущение кого-то за спиной и не покидающее тебя чувство того, что лес вокруг тебя живой, порой кажется что дышишь тем воздухом.
Очень сильно уделино внимание мелким деталям, я вместо того, что бы проходить сюжет по большей части лазил по местности и высматривал каждый метр наслаждаясь прекрасно проделанной работой.
Я очень остался доволен игрой и людям которые хотят погрузиться в интересную мистическую историю с головой советую её приобрести. Советую подумать перед покупкой людям у которых слабые копьютеры... Ибо будет тормозить.

Единственный минус для меня... Это 15 ФПС на низких настройках и 8 на максималках :D, но чёрть возьми так понравилась, что и на 8 играл.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045692513', 'num_games_owned': 1410, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1464913742}
review:
The Cursed Forest is an adventure horror game that I’ve been following for quite some time now. There’s a free but old version of the game and I had a great time with it. From what I can tell, the developers are expanding on the story of the Steam Early access version of the game and I’m glad because in the free version, the story was almost nonexistent. 

Just a warning, the Early Access version is about 30 minutes long, give or take the amount of time you spend on exploring. Only a small area of the forest is currently available. (how many times did I write version there)

The story is about this man, he receives a message that his mother was sent to the hospital so of course, as the world’s most caring son, he rushes to her, only to find himself in a car accident. Now, he’s trapped in this eerie forest (btw, this isn’t told in-game, at least, not to my knowledge. I read it from the steam page.) Through notes scattered all around the woods, it is revealed that there is some kind of entity killing off stranglers and travelers that roam the forest. 

The game’s sounds are spot on so wearing decent headphones is recommended. From the faint footsteps of our “stalker,” to the hushed whispers of the forests, I was freaking myself out, even when nothing is happening. In the beginning parts, the entity seems to be observing us, as if it’s gauging our reaction. I do remember in the free version, the entity becomes more aggressive later so that’s something to look forward to. So far, the game isn’t scary, however, it is unnerving. You get that sense that you’re being watched, before we are even aware of our “friend.” So, the scare factor of the game, on a scale of 1-10, (1 being, “me looking for something to scare me but couldn’t find it, no matter how hard I tried” and 10 being, “I ♥♥♥♥ my pants, I should’ve worn a diaper.” I rate The Cursed Forest a 6/10 (6 being, “Well, well. We’re getting there. What else ya got?”) Sorry, my rating is strange. I’m making it up as I go.

For the gameplay mechanics, there aren’t any puzzles (for now) but there are bones that need to be collected. It isn’t fully explained why our character is suddenly gathering 8 pieces of human remains but I just go with the flow, hoping that it will be touched upon later on. All I can do is wait and see. (If there is an explanation in game, please let me know. I’ll pay in cookies)

In the graphics side, the game is beautiful. Even in the free version, I was impressed with the details of the forest. I’m not surprised that it’s carried over to the Steam version. I haven’t had any problems, in terms of framerate drops, crashes, or bugs, but I’ve read in the forums that there are people struggling to maintain playable framerate. It is on the CryEngine but I’m reading even on decent hardware, players are having issues. (My Specs are GTX 970, i7-4790S, 12 GB of ram, so on and so forth.) Be aware of that. 

The game is constantly being patched so there’s involvement from the developer(s) and that’s good to see. I recommend it for now. I will update my review as the game updates. As with most Early Access games, The Cursed Forest isn’t finished so if you’re planning on buying it, just know that. Try out the free version first if you’re on the fence. You’ll get a sense of how the EA version will be. 

TL;DR

Pros:
- Great, unsettling atmosphere 
- Beautiful Graphics
- Great Sounds (wear headphones!)

Cons:
- Story is unclear (for now)
- Not sure why our character is collecting bones
- Optimization problems (reports on the forums)
- Current version only showcases about 30 minutes or so of gameplay

Thanks for reading!

When you have the time, watch me fool around in The Cursed Forest. Have a nice day!

[url=https://youtu.be/pnFuR2WVoQs] The Cursed Forest Video	[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198021543753', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1467796802}
review:
Very excited about this game!

So far the game is quite thin on the content, took me rougly 3 hours to complete it - and I'm a slow gamer. I tend to see the sights, explore every cave and look behing every tree and rock. But as far as I understood, this was only a section of game and there's more in the actual release version.

The game won't tell you much about how you got into the Cursed Forest or lead you towards any waypoints, which I think is a good thing. I like how I can draw my own conclusions and try to fit the pieces of puzzle myself. Occasionally you may find torn journal pages with some information but there are also subtle hints scattered around in the forest - I'll let you find those yourself. 

Gameplay feels really smooth, the visuals are stunning and even the audio side feels really good. The sounds of the forests, crows, crickets and wind combined with the atmospheric tunes, some occasional music... I really just gave in and let the game suck me right inside it's world.

As the game is still in Early Access and much of it's content is missing, it still gave me a really good experience. There were some nice spooky moments and in no point it felt like I'm playing a game full of horror/thriller clichés.

The tension in the game builds up slowly and you get a feeling that someone's watching you, or something is just about to happen if you blink your eyes now. From what I saw in the current build, it's not a gore massacre horror game. More like a mystical, bit scary adventure that can really suck you in if you let it happen. (turn on the headphones, mute your wife and phone and lock the man cave's door)

Now I just wish I could play some more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131393059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1595308739}
review: This game is awesome! Just when I had given up hope there would be any more cool horror games like Amnesia, Phantasmal, Kholat, and Penumbra, this gem appeared. The graphics are sublime, the story, (so far), engaging and keeps ones attention. It is not a typical horror game either. It is complex and well thought out. It doesn't lower itself to overdone typical enemies like serial killers with big knives, but rather this game plays on deep instinctual fears of being alone and essentially lost in the woods, lacing together things like abandoned dwellings, old magic,  wild animals, lake monsters, a good dose of supernaturalism, and more. I cannot say enough about this game. If you dig an intense atmosphere and horror that thinks and bites, this game is for you.  10/10 For story, graphics, overall playing and controls. A+!   I hope to see more from this developer~ Sarah

author: {'steamid': '76561198169311898', 'num_games_owned': 2181, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1506732428}
review:
Mysterious grunting from the treelines, scarecrows that move when you're not looking and monstrous rabbits lurking in cavernous burrows; The Cursed Forest is a pleasant break from half mutant serial killers stalking medical facilities and zombie hordes interrupting your attempts at deciphering another bewildering crafting system.
In its early stages, the game has all the atmosphere of a morbid children's story from the early 20th century, pointing you into the heart of the titular forest and inviting you to discover the eerie lore within. There's nothing so intense or vulgar as blood or guts on display here; the mood is held together by tales of disappearing villages, phantom deer and monsters that lurk in the lake and is far more of an exploratory experience than it is a QTE masher.
Very promising indeed.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wj7g7sCf4t0

author: {'steamid': '76561198023976800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1468265827}
review:
Играл еще в первую версию, и по сравнению с ней качество очень сильно возрасло, порадовало внимание к деталям, появление таких штук как:инвентарь и журнал записок . Атмосфера как была на отличном уровне ,так и осталась, ощущение, что за тобой кто-то следит не покидает тебя на всем протяжении игры, иногда даже страшно оборачиваться))
А если в целом ,то ребята очень хорошо постарались, надеемся что в следущих эпизодах будет все еще лучше.
На данный момент оценивать нельзя так как перед нами не цельный продукт а лишь  1/4 его часть. Так что пока"очень хорошо"

author: {'steamid': '76561197981782766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1442154630}
review:
ЭТО КРУТО!
это гениально!
ГЛАВНЫЙ ГГ - ХРОМОНОЖКА!!!!
этим можно обыграть его медлительность, задержку в беге, задержку при прыжке
он звуки прикольные издает
типо "звуки накладывания кирпичей" в момент, когда мост под ним сыпаться начал. Я от его восклицаний чуть не наложил
есть ощущение что оружия не хватает, из-за этого чувствовал себя беззащитной маленькой сучкой, в доме с привидениями и прочими жопонадирателями


Мне игра понравилась потому как:
- оригинальный подход к личности главного героя
- интересное начало
- квесты, которые заставляет включать голову
- монстра
- фановость и креативность команды разрабов проглядывается и в мелочах, как-то название достижений, интересные истории, периодически разбавленные пасхалками и мемами лвла.
 - атмосферность: звуки окружения, партиклы, шейдера
- компоновка уровня, подбор цветов

Слабые стороны у проекта тоже присутствуют, но команда разрабов активно закрывает дыры, что радует. С благодарностью принимают отзывы о существующих багах, что говорит о заинтересованности в улучшении продукта.
Слабые стороны:
- система GUI иногда подлагивает
- мне было обидно когда не поднялась морковка =-(

author: {'steamid': '76561198113862025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 298, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1567337275}
review:
Sincèrement, j'ai longtemps cru que ce jeu ne sortirait jamais de son accès anticipé, raison pour laquelle j'avais presque fini par l'oublier... Mais la récente sortie de "Blair witch" m'a donné envie de le relancer, et c'est donc l'occasion de mettre mon ancienne éval à jour maintenant que ce "Cursed Forest" est ENFIN achevé.
Et je dois dire que j'ai vraiment passé un très agréable moment dans cette somptueuse forêt maudite!

Jeu d'exploration / épouvante (et [i]simulateur de marche[/i] plus ou moins bien assumé), The Cursed Forset regorge de très bonnes choses - malgré de tout petits détails potentiellement agaçants par moments, mais jamais rédhibitoires.

Si le jeu a parfois de faux airs de Dear Ester ou d'Ethan Carter dans son concept, je le comparerai principalement à ce qui lui est le plus comparable : sa version gratuite, que j'ai eu l'occasion de parcourir et terminer avant de m’atteler à cette version steam.
Difficile de ne pas la comparer à ce [i]remake payant[/i] : cette réédition reprend globalement certaines phases et mécaniques de l'original, tout en bénéficiant d'une excellente rénovation de sa plastique, de son ergonomie, et de son interface.

[list]
    [*]Ce qui m'a frappée dès les 1eres minutes de ce petit périple dans ce "bois maudit", c'est à quel point son atmosphère est maîtrisée à la perfection ! La réalisation continue d'impressionner carrément même en 2019 : on nous offre une forêt aussi foisonnante que sublime esthétiquement, qui n'a rien à envier techniquement à bien des jeux "AAA". Il fait bon se perdre au gré des petits sentiers couverts de racines et de feuille mortes qui serpentent dans un level design bien pensé! Et si vous préférez couper à travers bois, c'est la plupart du temps possible.
La végétation est dense, belle, variée, le décor est certes un peu redondant – fatalement puisque c'est une forêt – mais franchement inspiré et bien réalisé. (C'est valable pour les deux versions du jeu, mais celle ci – la version steam, bénéficie d'un joli lifting qui parvient à donner un nouveau visage au protagoniste central qu'est cette "cursed forest", tout en préservant sa très singulière identité très marquante). Une réussite esthétique, artistique, et technique.

    [*]Ayant joué avec un casque, je trouve que le travail sur les sons épaissit bien l'ambiance aux moment opportuns, et traduit la sensation de traverser des feuillages, de patauger dans une flaque d'eau, ou de s'empêtrer dans la boue poisseuse d'une zone marécageuse. La musique est plus discrète, mais très agréable, et colle assurément au ton du reste. L'étang grouille de moustiques aux bourdonnements stressants, les cris lointains (ou proches) des animaux de la forêt aident à renforcer la justesse de ce décorum vraiment très réussi, tandis que quelques sons purement atmosphériques parviennent à installer une certaine angoisse!

    [*]Cette forêt brumeuse se révèle oppressante à souhait, mais sans jamais devenir vraiment terrifiante, et j'ai personnellement bien apprécié cela : Pas de jumpscares abusifs, (bien qu'il y en ait quelques uns dans la version d'origine), pas de gore... On reste dans la suggestion dérangeante de se savoir suivie dans un endroit inquiétant et manifestement hanté par une entité agressive. C'est très suffisant pour fonctionner parfaitement, et donner une touche très particulière et attachante au jeu.

    [*]Contrairement à beaucoup trop de titres du genre, la vitesse de déplacement est tout à fait correcte. Le jeu offre même la possibilité de courir assez vite dans cette nouvelle version, en plus de pouvoir sauter, s'accroupir, nager... Très plaisant.

    [*]Les objets à collecter viendront récompenser l'exploration minutieuse des lieux, tandis que l'histoire assez touchante se distille par bribes sous forme de textes trouvés ça et là.
La traduction française est d'excellente facture au passage.

[/list]
Bien que quelques petits détails pénibles subsistent encore, la plupart des défauts que j'avais à lui adresser lors de son early access sont désormais corrigés. (Preuve que les devs sont bien à l'écoute des retours de la communauté).
[list]
    [*]Désormais, la mire [i](le minuscule point blanc en plein milieu de l'écran façon skyrim)[/i] s'estompe au bout d'un temps lorsqu'on ne touche à rien, ce qui est fort appréciable si comme moi vous faites beaucoup de screenshoots. (Sachant que l'absence totale de HUD accentue beaucoup l'immersion et l'esthétisme du jeu).

    [*]Contrairement à la version gratuite, le pad est pris en compte (mais partiellement) dans la version steam. Mais globalement, toute l'interface à la manette reste bien trop capricieuse et approximative. La touche de course est sur le clic du stick gauche, et les touches ne sont PAS paramétrables. Il me semblerait (personnellement) plus ergonomique de mettre la course sur une touche inutilisée, plutôt que de conserver cette norme purement FPS qui est finalement peu pratique et que je trouve assez désagréable. Le bumper ou la gâchette gauche (inutilisée) me paraîtrait plus ergonomique.

En revanche, les touches au clavier / souris sont entièrement remappables, et j'ai donc préféré jouer avec ces périphériques que j'ai trouvés finalement plus agréables à utiliser.

    [*]Le jeu “peine” (voire crash) au démarrage et dans le réglage des options  ; idem pour charger les textures lorsqu'on le lance. En revanche une fois lancé, je n'ai personnellement jamais eu aucun crash, ni aucun problème technique particulier. Seul le 1er chargement est long.

    [*]Que le jeu soit hyper scripté ne me pose aucun souci. En revanche,  la surabondance de téléportations suite à des chutes /pièges finit par agacer et s'avérer maladroite, du fait que le jeu nous retire soudain le contrôle de la promenade. (Heureusement, les nombreux points de save permettent éventuellement de revenir éventuellement explorer en arrière, mais quand même...)

    [*]Même en réglant la luminosité au max, certaines séquences sont parfois trop sombres, imposant de jouer soit la nuit, soit avec les volets et rideaux fermés pour distinguer quoi que ce soit.
Et si je conçois bien en quoi cette obscurité a un sens scénaristique (et une fonction atmosphérique), elle s'avère parfois un peu handicapante en terme de confort de jeu. (Ces passages quasi-opaques sont heureusement rare).

    [*]Mon compteur affiche 7h car je me suis baladée environ deux heures et demi durant l'accès anticipé. J'ai donc recommencé du début, et ça m'a pris environ 4,5h pour le terminer, sachant que j'ai vraiment pris mon temps pour farfouiller partout!
La durée de vie me semble donc très acceptable personnellement... (Tout comme l'était celle de la version gratuite d'ailleurs).  Mais pour une personne qui "rush" comme un porc, je pense que le jeu peut se boucler bien plus rapidement. (Obtenir tous les succès prendra sans doute du temps en revanche).

    [*]Idem pour son prix de 11€ qui me parait franchement correct vu l'excellente qualité de l'ensemble.
Même si ce jeu était initialement gratuit, l'impressionnant travail effectué ici et le talent des créateurs méritent indéniablement une juste rémunération.

Donc si vous n'êtes pas complètement sur(e) de vous, attendez peut être une solde - ou essayez vous à [url=http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-cursed-forest/downloads/the-cursed-forest-15-full-version]la version gratuite[/url] toujours mise à disposition en ligne [b]PAR[/b] [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/345430/discussions/0/517141624286226199/] les créateurs du jeu [/url]. 
[/list]

Cette refonte de The cursed Forest ne s'adresse bien sur pas à tout le monde : les allergiques aux simulateurs de marche et ceux qui ne jurent que par le "gore" y resteront sans doute insensibles.
En revanche, si vous appréciez comme moi de vous balader dans de somptueux décors, l'épouvante soft qui ne sombre jamais dans le "traumatisant gratuit", et les petits jeux indés d'un soir hyper agréables à explorer, franchement lancez vous !

author: {'steamid': '76561198055441638', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1580445345}
review:
I for one have been following this game since its IndieDB days, having watched both Markiplier and LordMinion777 enjoy this game and have been looking forward to this game appearing on Steam since it was Greenlit.

I have not been disappointed. 

This game is even more beautiful than the original, there are numerous improvements to the graphics, to the flow of the game and not to mention even more surprises hidden about this unique landscape.

One major improvement has been the save points, they are placed in various locations throughout the game. A step in the right direction in my opinion, as not only do I wish to experience the correct path in the game, but also experience each of the wrong paths as well in order to see everything this game has to offer for scares and creepies.

Now for the technical side. 

I have NOT experienced a single issue with saving, loading, or any of the gameplay in general. No errors, no crashes and no unexpected shutdowns. For an Early Access Game, I cannot express properly how well done this first release is. The only errors/issues I may have experienced  are already known. Muddy textures that correct themselves after a few seconds when you first start up the game and a few spelling errors in some of the notes (Alters which are supposed to be Altars).  Minor issues all in all.

For all the bad reviews that have been put on this game, I must admit, in my own experience with the game, most if not all of them are false.

I recommend this game to anyone who's interested in an immersive and unique fear experience and those who understand that this IS an Early Access Game.

PROS:
-Immersive Experience
-Gorgeous Graphics
-Unique Effects
-Not your traditional jumpscare filled horror game

CONS:
-Minor loading issues that are already known about
-The landscape is so well done it is very easy to miss a path (Not a major con, just means you have to pay closer attention!)
-Would LOVE to have a way to mark which paths I've been on. (A way to mark the ground with a stick or the like. Again, not a major con, just a minor addition that'd make it easier to explore.)

I highly recommend The Cursed Forest and look forward to the next chapter that is to be released/added to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141299554', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1880, 'last_played': 1704028097}
review:
Спустя 3 года и 4 месяца пришла пора дописать мой скромный мини-обзорчик на данную игру. А вернее переписать его совсем. А ещё вернее - беспощадно удалить старый обзор, чтобы написать новый. А повод простой: игра, можно сказать, уже доделана до конца.

Я вообще очень люблю всякие фильмы ужасов и игры с призраками девочек ("онрё" с японской мифологии). И вот давным давно пригляделась оригинальная бесплатная [b]The Cursed Forest[/b]. Но я не сразу решился в неё играть. Но однажды, собрав всю свою растерянную храбрость в кучу, я всё-таки смог это сделать. Серьёзно, я до смерти боялся эту чёрную девочку. Как она появляется, как она пробегает от дерева к дереву с искажениями на экране и мрачным звуком. Как она расставляет свои приманки-ловушки, а я ведусь как дурачок. Это было просто шикарно! Оригинальную игру вроде и сейчас можно сыграть, если CryDevlogin позволит.

А позже узнал про создание ремейка - данной игры. Сразу же купил её, как только она стала доступна в раннем доступе. И при первом входе в игру я сразу подумал "Опа, нифига себе! Какая красота!". Да, может в оригинальной игре лес был страшнее, темнее, опаснее, а в ремейке как-то мне показалось всё окружение мягче, красивее. Места вроде знакомые, но сделано это как-то по-другому. Больше записок, которые рассказывают о событиях произошедших в лесу. И самое главное - меня обрадовало наличие записок от самой Сары - проклятой девочки, что позволяет понять, какова она была при жизни. Да и записки чувака, который побывал до нас тоже очень к месту.

Помимо того, что лесь стал больше, он же ещё стал живее. Здесь появились не совсем живые олень и заяц, огородное пугало, детские игрушки, которые вроде и милые, но при первой игре меня немного напрягали. Эдакое разнообразие.

К сожалению, я до сих пор не смог найти несколько записок - про какие-то я уже забыл, а какие-то надо искать как-то "на слух". Из-за чего я не смог понять некоторые тонкости сюжета. Будем ещё перепроходить. Ближе к концу мне даже стало немного грустно после прочтения очередной записки. В оригинале такого у меня не было.

Графика тут шикарная. На некоторых этапах появлялись глюки, баги освещения, но сейчас уже всё исправлено. Сделанный мною скриншот из игры у меня даже стоит на фоне рабочего стола. Играю, естественно, на максимально возможных настройках.

Очень понравилось и звуковое сопровождение, просто пятёрка. Звук дождя в 5-ой главе при игре в наушниках даже немного заставил меня прикрыть глаза и представить, что дождь льёт мне прямо на голову. Мне это показалось очень реалистичным.

Был ли ремейк страшным ? Несмотря на то, что я побаиваюсь приведений, я отвечу - нет. Да, есть некоторые неожиданные события а-ля скримеры. Но для меня страшнее оказалась не сама девочка (она тут своими руками почти не убивает), а её "сюрпризы" в виде приманок и ловушек.
developer_response: Мы знаем о баге с настройками, работаем над этим.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048974498', 'num_games_owned': 2973, 'num_reviews': 812, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1685011444}
review:
I ended up playing TWO brand-new horror games tonight.  The other one was your typical, generic, steaming-pile-of-dog-turd whipped up overnight by some enterprising (read: cynical and money-driven) fourteen year-old (its name is "BlackShadows", in case you have a few bucks you don't have the heart to simply flush straight down the toilet).  The other one...was this.  Suffice it to say, this one won.  By a looooooooong margin...

   To say that this (still very) Early Access game shows "potential" would be as self-evident as saying that Michael Bay needs to be drawn-and-quartered in a public square (before posting said footage all over YouTube-land as evidence of what we civilised folk do to people who can't even make GIANT FUCKING ROBOT movies remotely exciting).  Already, this game has more to offer than the vast majority of other "horror" games released onto Steam since, well...since basically all this Greenlight and Early Access nonsense started up, to be honest.  

   Rest assured, for once, this ISN'T just some "small development team" (read: one dude in his bedroom) who's whipped up a quick trailer and some semi-snazzy screenshots to dupe the idiot consumer (read: me) into giving them money for something which they put together in one afternoon (and maybe a tiny bit of the evening).  Nosirree.  The attention to detail in this game will make your JAW DROP.  Why are there small rocks falling on me from above?  Look up...holy fuck, there's a skinny, creepy-assed black figure with red eyes running over a stone bridge above me!  Wonder what happens if I wade any further into this lake?  Holy old Jesus, I'm actually SWIMMING, in first-person no less, and what the...I've just been eaten by a GIANT FISH!!  And all this in just my first hour of casually wandering about and wondering exactly what I'm doing, but honestly, it's all so splendidly atmospheric and immersive that I frankly don't GIVE a damn!!!

   If only all Early Access games were this promising.  It's obviously hard to give it a very definitive verdict yet, not least of all because disaster could still strike and the entire production team might all spontaneously combust, but at least we know these guys are in it for the RIGHT reasons.  Trust me, you only need play this for ten or twenty minutes to work THAT much out.  Oh, and for those of you out there who like comparisons? The games this reminds me of the most, thus far, are Among the Sleep and Kholat, with a hearty dose of fairytale-esque shenanigans added to the pot.  This is definitely shaping up to be one of THE horror games of 2015.  Or...2016, or whenever it gets finished.  One game which might actually be worth the trouble of holding your breath over.

Verdict: 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992674721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 568, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1551110812}
review:
Wow i think this is the best horror adventure game i played, i mean ever. First the use of cryengine 3 here is perfect, some true next-gen visuals here and lots of attention to detail, you feel in a AAA game when it's only indie (you can see my screenshots and admire, but ingame it is a lot more impressive even).

The atmosphere stands out, it's not too spooky, like some other horror games but more atmospheric i'd say. The green taint of the game is exquisit, i never saw that in another game. Sound effects of the forest are very very immersive, you hear crows, animals, the water, the tree's, the leaves shiver and everything is alive, even tho it's kinda a dead raw forest, it's full of life yes.

I recommend this game even at this stage and at the early access price, because it's already very polished even if a bit short, but the dev's looks very serious and will add a lot of chapters and new content to the game.

Yes, i call this game a gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123412837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1590311259}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064898435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1442057695}
review: Я конечно подобные бродилки не люблю и считаю такие игры полной хренью! Но тут чуваки постарались и сделили чёткий намаз на уровне! а значит это что уровень годный и графон норм хоть и не реальистичный ! вобмщем 7/10 кукушек! Любителям подобных бродилок должно понравиться!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965282243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1592294743}
review:
[b]This is an Early Access review and I will change it when the game is finished.[/b]

Note: Have you noticed the negative reviews are from people who have 2 products and only 2 or 3 reviews?  Ahem...NOT [i]REAL[/i] GAMERS!

I'm a fan of horror games and I liked this game when I played the original free version.  I was so excited when I found out a remake was releasing on Steam.  So far, I'm impressed!  Yes the game is a little buggy because it's in early access and still being worked on.  The bugs I've encountered aren't game breakers.

For a horror game this is an excellent game.  Not long into the forest and I was already getting nervous!  There's so much detail in the forest.  The environment, ambience, sounds...it's so creepy!  This game is also a HUGE improvement from the original.  More game settings, has save points, graphical improvements, etc.  The graphics are great but I've noticed they take a minute to fully load and the devs are aware of this.  Some people may have issues playing it but I know from playing this that it'll soon be an A+ horror game.  Give them time.

[b]Pros[/b]
Excellent horror game.
Environment.
Game settings.
Save points.
Developers are actively working on the game and communicating with gamers.

[b]Cons[/b]
(These are due to the game still being programmed.)
It's buggy...duh.
Game takes a while to load.
Textures take a while to fully load at start of game.
The notes you find in the game are plain text and don't look like they're written on paper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086542708', 'num_games_owned': 6444, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1442045836}
review:
After reading the IndieDB for the original version of this game, it seems this is basically a more interesting, less linear feeling, Into Blue Valley. So if you liked that then pick it up.

Quite enjoyed this. Decent atmosphere & setting; don't quite understand why I'm collecting random bones but benefit of the doubt that I will understand that in the full game & at least it isn't keys to unlock doors.
Also, for a game whose save menu seems to be written in a language that isn't english, the notes are remarkably well written with only mispelling Altar in the note about Altars, it gets written as alter but way better than english than some of the other indie horror titles.

I get the feeling it will end up as more walking simulator than horror & I probably will be essentially collecting keys by some other name, but I'm okay with that if the setting & story are good enough & this looks promising.

review: Что сказать на счет игры. Игра в целом мне приятна, в начале игры обратил внимания на графику, графика была приятна глазу, это мягко сказанно. Есть проблемы, но они незначительные, думаю разработчики решат эту проблему быстро). Так же было 2 момента, где не сказать что испугался, но было не приятно не ожидал пугалки в них. надеюсь что дальше будет еще страшнее и загадочнее. В общем жду дальнейшей истории! Удачи вам !))))))))

author: {'steamid': '76561198020085437', 'num_games_owned': 1081, 'num_reviews': 400, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1549747659}
review:
As i see some of the other reviews seem to have some performance troubles, I have to say that I had no crashes, and kept a good 60fps while recording, smoothe experience for me.
I like the visuals, and the sounds in this game, well made. Its not too scary but that could improve when the game expands. Also Please note that this early access is very short, but as they mentioned this is only chapter one of the game, More will come.

I enjoyed the game, but it is short.

https://youtu.be/bGkJNZWqj6g

author: {'steamid': '76561198200673262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1441997196}
review:
I strongly don't recommend to buy this game right now!

1) Crashes and freezes. During 30 minutes of gameplay game crashed 3 times.
2) The game is very short.
3) Bad optimization. Fraps shows about 30-40 fps. And this is on my gtx 980!
4) Bad saving system. It doesn't work properly.
5) A LOT OF bugs with collisions. Also there are some parts of the level, where you can fall out of the map.
6) The game is VERY DARK. In the beginning it's ok, but then...
developer_response:
1) Есть краши при загрузке, при игре - нет (убраны по фидбеку от пользователей).
2) Игра стала длинее + все последующие эпизоды достанутся бесплатно.
3) Проверь кадровую частоту ещё раз, а ещё лучше настройки драйвера. У меня на 970 в fullHD - 60 кадров в секунду. Стабильно. На ультрах.
4) Всё работает.
5) Убрали баги с коллизией, остались в паре новых моментов.
6) Можно увеличить яркость в настройках игры.
